codeChecker.title: Code Checker
codeChecker.description: Effortlessly validate your generative art code. Drop your file, check for essentials, and optimize. Preview, iterate, and finalize with confidence. Start now.
codeChecker.uploadInstructions: Drop your code file here or click to select, and initiate the automated review.
codeChecker.usingParamHash: Param Hash From Url For Rendering
codeChecker.validImage: Valid Image Sent to Kodahash Render
codeChecker.confidentialCode: Rest Assured, Your Code Remains Confidential With Us. It Is Solely Used For Internal Evaluation Purposes And Will Not Be Distributed, Shared, Or Sold In Any Form.
codeChecker.learnAboutGenArt: Learn About Generative Art On Chaotic
codeChecker.usingKodaHashMeans: Using Kodahash means your code properly communicates with the rendering system. You need to implement the postMessageKoda function that sends the rendered canvas data to the parent window.
codeChecker.correctHTMLNameMeans: Your HTML file should have a proper title tag that describes your art, not just 'KodaHash'.
codeChecker.kodaHashCalledOnceMeans: The postMessageKoda function should be called only once per render cycle, typically at the end of your draw function.
codeChecker.notUsingExternalResourcesMeans: Your code should not depend on external resources that might not be available. All assets should be included in your ZIP file.
codeChecker.usingParamHashMeans: Your code should use URL parameters to get the hash value for rendering. This allows for consistent rendering across different sessions.
codeChecker.validImageMeans: Payload Send to kodahash render is empty or the image field is null. In Order to resolve this issue, you need to make sure that the image field is not null.
codeChecker.consistentArtMeans: Your art should be consistent - the same hash should always produce the same visual output.
codeChecker.automaticResizeMeans: Your code should handle different canvas sizes automatically using resizeCanvas or similar functions.
codeChecker.variationLoadingTimeMeans: Your art should render within a reasonable time frame to ensure good user experience.
codeChecker.variationLoadingTimeMeans1: The time between the start of render and message kodahash/render/completed is measured. As we mentioned in the documentation, art should be quick, to make the experience for the user better. Loading time check could fail if:
codeChecker.variationLoadingTimeMeans2: Artwork is not rendered in the checker.
codeChecker.variationLoadingTimeMeans3: Takes too long to render, no clear way to fix that, the artist needs to find a way to cut down time.
